reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room with pool view at the ground floor. We could almost walk directly from our rooms into the pool. Which we could see, that our neighbor’s three small girls really enjoyed, when we were sitting at our terrace. The room was decorated in Thai style and has a good size; also the bathroom was excellent with Jacuzzi for two and a really spacious shower. The room was very clean, not even dust under the bed. The room was quiet, and air-condition was working fine.
reviews.title: Excellent for honeymoon

likes.disliked: — Bar prices were a bit above average

reviews.title: The Most Amazing, Romantic Getaway....
reviews.text: The pool is not big, but it never seems to be a problem, as only a few guests are using it at the same time. The breakfast is good, some hotels have a larger selection of food, but I find the selection and quality provided good, and it would cover everybody’s taste and needs. The beach is wonderful for sunbathing, it´s very quiet, and it wonderful being there reading magazines or books.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service on the beach is perfect. The staffs help you with sun chairs and umbrellas, and come with water, shakes, drinks and food, as you order from your chair. Further do I like the possibility to buy a freshly printed Danish newspaper from the newspaper woman walking on the beach every morning. In the corner of the beach is there a small tent with the possibility to buy massage for up to 4 guests at the time, at a price of 300 bath. I´m unsure if this is part of the spa at the hotel, or they just have permission to be at the hotel beach. You need to walk a few minutes, if you want to go swimming at the beach. Personally I don´t see this a problem, as this is why the beach is so quiet and relaxing, and it´s almost the only exercise I get during my vacation.
reviews.title: Paradise

likes.disliked: — The pool was a little shaded with trees but the beach makes up for it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend an I stayed at Muang Samui for 8 days in July/ August 2008. We really liked our room (Junior Suite), the staff was very kind and helpful (espessially at the Restaurant), we adored thw Rai Ra Spa, where we had 3 treatments and would definitelly go back!!!! The only disadvantage is that the property is small (but i think most Resorts in Samui are small) so if one stays longer than a week it could be boring. We liked the pool and we spent most of the time there since we didn' t like the sea.. The food at the Restaurant was absolutely perfect and the general atmosphere of the Hotel really romantic.....
reviews.title: Unforgettable Holidays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Muang Samui for 7 nights in May. (We booked through agoda.com with no problems). Having done extensive research on the internet, we had high expectations of this place and we were not disappointed at all! The service was indeed first rate, from the check-in in the outdoor lobby, cleaning of the rooms, poolside food and drink service, breakfast staff, dinner on the beach, and help arranging activities- we were treated with Thai kindness and warmth at every step. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous and hugely spacious. The location was perfect IF you want to be on Chaweng Beach- it sits at the north end of the "strip" so you are close, and can walk everywhere on Chaweng, but never felt trapped in the middle of it all. In fact, when on the property itself, one forgets that the main street of Chaweng Beach is there at all. The breakfast buffet every morning was terrific, with so many choices I don't see how anyone could get tired of it or complain- everything was fresh and delicious. We had dinner on the beach at their restaurant twice, and yes it is a bit more expensive than alot of other restaurants on Samui, but not by alot, and the service and quality of food, and atmosphere at the edge of the water made it worth it.
reviews.title: Excellence in every way
